title: DV_TEXT
description:
A text item, which may contain any amount of legal characters arranged as e.g. words, sentences etc (i.e. one `DV_TEXT` may be more than one word). Visual formatting and hyperlinks may be included. 

A `DV_TEXT` can be  coded  by adding mappings to it. 

Fragments of text, whether coded or not are used on their own as values, or to make up larger tracts of text which may be marked up in some way, eventually going to make up paragraphs.
$comments: Defined in Data_types IM, inherits from DATA_VALUE

value.description: Displayable rendition of the item, regardless of its underlying structure. For `DV_CODED_TEXT`, this is the rubric of the complete term as provided by the terminology service. No carriage returns, line feeds, or other non-printing characters permitted.

hyperlink.description: Optional link sitting behind a section of plain text or coded term item.

formatting.description:
A format string of the form `"name:value; name:value..."` , e.g. `"font-weight : bold; font-family : Arial; font-size : 12pt;"`. 

Values taken from W3C CSS2 properties lists  back-ground and font .

mappings.description: Terms from other terminologies most closely matching this term, typically used where the originator (e.g. pathology lab) of information uses a local terminology but also supplies one or more equivalents from well known terminologies (e.g. LOINC).

language.description: Optional indicator of the localised language in which the value is written. Coded from openEHR Code Set  languages . Only used when either the text object is in a different language from the enclosing `ENTRY`, or else the text object is being used outside of an `ENTRY` or other enclosing structure which indicates the language.

encoding.description: Name of character encoding scheme in which this value is encoded. Coded from openEHR Code Set  character sets . Unicode is the default assumption in openEHR, with UTF-8 being the assumed encoding. This attribute allows for variations from these assumptions.

Valid_value.description: not value.is_empty and then not (value.has(CR) or value.has(LF))
